doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Rainer Steckhan held on November 13, 1985
doc.abstracts: On November 13, 1985, Rainer Steckhan was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1964 to 1995, Mr. Steckhan worked in the following areas: as a young professional (1964); as executive assistant to the president (1964-1969); in eastern Africa as deputy chief to the permanent mission (1969-1971); in the western Africa region as division chief (1971-1977) and as director of the country programs department (1977-1978); in the European office as director (1978-1983); in the Latin America and Caribbean (LAC) region as director of the country programs department (1983-1987), the country department (1987-1994), and the special operations (1994-1995). He is a lawyer by training. His transcript concerns the legal department, his contributions to the LAC region, and the World Bank during the presidency of George Woods.
